title: Can not sign in to Gmail via Oauth "Allow"
creator: larrygad
content:
I've followed Thunderbird setup according to "Automatic Conversion of Google mail accounts to OAuth 2.0 Authentication" (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/automatic-conversion-google-mail-accounts-oauth20) The failure is described in my initial post below:

Mozilla Support - Signin, and use of Thunderbird https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1484529#answer-1729438

LarryGad post (Reply to Ashley LambertonQuestion owner): I get the same screenshot Ashley posted above. But...clicking Allow doesn't download my Gmail messages. And clicking the link, Account Permissions, just produces a blank window. An idiosyncrasy is I'm the domain administrator for a "Free Legacy Edition of G Suite for personal use".

This paragraph may not be relevant to the above issue. I did stumble across the Account settings link (https://myaccount.google.com/general-light?pli=1) which contains the line: 'Connected accounts View and manage your accounts from other services' Clicking the 'View ...' link goes to https://profiles.google.com/connectedaccounts and displays the message: "404. That’s an error. The requested URL was not found on this server. That’s all we know." Highlighting the 'View ...' link shows https://profiles.google.com/connectedaccounts?authuser=0

Thanks in advance.

title: Problemas en el correo electrónico
creator: cendaldavid
content:
Hola buenas tardes, desde el día 28 de abril, tras el apagón, no tenemos correo electrónico. No recibimos, ni podemos enviar correos. Nos sale el mensaje que adjuntamos, y que también describimos, y que es el siguiente: "Fallo el envío del mensaje. El mensaje no se ha podido enviar porque ha fallado la conexión al servidor de salida (SMTP). El servidor puede no estar disponible o está rechazando conexiones SMTP. Verifique que los ajustes de su servidor de salida (SMTP) son correctos y vuelva a intentarlo." Necesitamos a la mayor urgencia una respuesta. Gracias

Hello, good afternoon. Since April 28th, after the blackout, we have no email. We neither receive not send emails. We receive the attached message, which we also describe, which is as follows: "Message sending failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to the outgoing server (SMTP) failed. The server may be unavailable or is rejecting SMTP connections. Verify that your outgoing server (SMTP) settings are correct and try again." We urgently need a response. Thank you.

title: Lost ability to manage 'view' since recent update
creator: vin17246
content:
I am a long term user of Thunderbird as my email client.

During this past week I have lost the ability to manage my screen.

When I go to view/layout I get the menu, but no matter what I click on (classic, wide, or vertical), nothing changes. I’ve lost the 4th pane showing the body of the message, retaining only the 3 right panels [folders, correspondents, and subject heading]. I have to double click each line item to view the message in a separate pane and then double click again to close it to return to the base listings.

(I see I failed to mention that I am handicapped and I manage my keyboard by spearing each key with my stiff 3rd finger.)

My 'help/about' information reassures me that my updates are current and in fact date from this past Tuesday. 

   Thunderbird Desktop

Version 128.10.0esr | Released April 29, 2025 I suggest that the problem is that update.

Please advise. I am trying to avoid uninstalling&reinstalling the whole application. I fear I’ll lose all of the messages saved in my folders sidebar.

Thank you Marvin Lauwasser

title: Get Messages stops working; need to restart Thunderbird
creator: trumpman
content:
I've been using Thunderbird for decades. I have Thunderbird set to automatically download messages every 5 minutes. Platform: Computer Win11 Home, Thunderbird 128.10.0esr (64-bit), POP3 connection (also with IMAP connection on a MacOS computer.

But a new issue is now occurring. Every so often now, I realize I haven't received any new email downloads in some time. I click on the Get Messages button (or right-click and select items individually), but nothing happens - no "Host Contacted..." message in the Status Bar. It's like the Get Messages function is completely disabled. It is only when I quit then restart Thunderbird does it successfully establish a connection and download the many queued emails.

Please let me know if this is a known bug, or if there is a way to submit this as a bug. Also let me know of any other information you would need in order to help debug this issue. Thanks!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/133.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 OPR/118.0.0.0

title: Error code: MODIFICATION_FAILED when updating Proton Calendar
creator: carl.zetie
content:
I have been successfully using Thunderbird for several weeks with my Protonmail account. I have four Proton calendars that I created as "on the network" using the links provided by Proton Calendar with full edit permissions.

This all worked fine up until yesterday: I could create, edit, delete events in all four calendars and they were synced to Proton without issue.

Starting today, I now get this message when I try to create, edit, or delete events in any calendar:

An error occurred when writing to the calendar calendar! Please see below for more information. Error code: MODIFICATION_FAILED. Description: If you're seeing this [etc. etc.]

I checked the Console log and all it contains is the exact same message.

I can successfully edit the calendar in Proton, and changes still sync to Thunderbird.

Things I have tried: - Upgrading both Thunderbird and Proton calendar to latest releases - Unsubscribing from the calendar in Thunderbird and creating a new subscription - Creating a brand new calendar in Proton (export all events from old calendar, import to new) and subscribe to that calendar - Clearing Thunderbird's cache - Asking for help in the Proton help forums

Any suggestions are very welcome. To reiterate, this started spontaneously today.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:138.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/138.0

title: Filters on IMAP account work too fast and emails filtered to local folder don't always include body
creator: farmerben
content:
I am running TB 128.5.2esr on a new Macbook pro. I've recently been forced off POP into IMAP using OAUTH by google which now requires IMAP only with Google workspace emails. I have a somewhat detailed folder structure for all my incoming mail that benefits from TB filters.

At first I tried reconstructing this folder structure on the IMAP server, but it was a nightmare and did not work correctly.

I have finally found a solution where I filter all incoming email onto a local folder set. However am now finding that the bodies of the filtered emails are coming blank 50% of the time - most likely because the filter is executing faster than the IMAP will load the whole message.

Is there a way to delay the filter execution on the IMAP inbox so that when the filter executes it will copy the message headers AND the body reliably?

In case someone is wondering: this is not a network or connection issue. I am running on hardwired connection on fiber network, and the messages that make it or don't make it are randomly sized (small ones fail while big ones don't and vice versa).

Setting aside the POP vs. IMAP discussions, I will say that I miss POP because it allowed me to "catch" all my email in the gmail server, while using it as I saw fit on my TB/local computer. Now I'm required to mirror both - which is not helpful to me.

Thank you for any help.
metadata: ;solver_id:6686096;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.15; rv:136.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/136.0;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/faq-changing-imap-pop"]
